paragraphs.title: Welcome to AIA.
paragraphs.text: This is a live tutorial, you can run the code yourself. Recommended is to run paragraph by paragraph, you can click on the 'play' button in each paragraph or use shortcut <shift>+<Enter>. also you can run all the paragraphs by clicking 'play' button above.

paragraphs.title: INTRODUCTION
paragraphs.text:
%md
*This tutorial uses [BPS](http://analytics.ericsson.se/#/Products) based spark streaming application to receive apache web server access log text from kafka, convert to GenericRecord, dump to hive table for exploratory analysis and forward to different kafka topic for northbound interface. AIA PaasManager is used to deploy the application as a service.*

![picture of the whole work flow](http://analytics.ericsson.se:23307/wp-content/uploads/2017/01/spark_streaming_app_example.png)

**The following are based on example(/home/cloud-user/example/spark-streaming-example-app) provided in sandbox. This turtorial is provided as a quick start executed in zeppelin, please follow the README.md in application folder for detailed instruction.**

*The example is created using [AIA portal application builder](http://analytics.ericsson.se/#/GetStarted/ecosystem/appbuilder/applications) and the following files(relative path to the application folder) need to be added or modified to achieve the functionality*
1. flow.xml: flow descriptor used by BPS for work flow. Please check **_FLOW DESCRIPTOR_** for file content
2. src/main/java/com/ericsson/aia/bps/streaming/correlations/SparkStreamingExampleApp.java: spark driver class. Please check **_SPARK STREAMING DRIVER CLASS_** for details
3. src/main/java/com/ericsson/aia/bps/streaming/correlations/AccessLogRecord.java: pojo class used by [httpdlog-parser](https://github.com/nielsbasjes/logparser) to parse log text. Please check **_POJO FOR ACCESS LOG_** for details.
4. pba.json: PaaS deployment descriptor. Please check **_PBA DESCRIPTOR_** for details.

result.msg:
This tutorial uses BPS based spark streaming application to receive apache web server access log text from kafka, convert to GenericRecord, dump to hive table for exploratory analysis and forward to different kafka topic for northbound interface. AIA PaasManager is used to deploy the application as a service.

The following are based on example(/home/cloud-user/example/spark-streaming-example-app) provided in sandbox. This turtorial is provided as a quick start executed in zeppelin, please follow the README.md in application folder for detailed instruction.

The example is created using AIA portal application builder and the following files(relative path to the application folder) need to be added or modified to achieve the functionality

  1. flow.xml: flow descriptor used by BPS for work flow. Please check FLOW DESCRIPTOR for file content
  2. src/main/java/com/ericsson/aia/bps/streaming/correlations/SparkStreamingExampleApp.java: spark driver class. Please check SPARK STREAMING DRIVER CLASS for details
  3. src/main/java/com/ericsson/aia/bps/streaming/correlations/AccessLogRecord.java: pojo class used by httpdlog-parser to parse log text. Please check POJO FOR ACCESS LOG for details.
  4. pba.json: PaaS deployment descriptor. Please check PBA DESCRIPTOR for details.

paragraphs.title: STEP
paragraphs.text:
%md
1. Please follow **_AIA avro schema tutorial_ Notebook** to import avro schema for this example. 

2. Please follow **_STOP RUNNING APPLICATION_ paragraph** to stop any existing running application or service.

3. Please follow **_DROP OUTPUT TABLE_ paragraph** to drop the output hive table.

4. Please follow **_BUILD APPLICATION PROJECT_ paragraph** to build the maven based application.

5. Please follow **_STOP DATA SOURCE & START DATA SOURCE_ paragraphs** to re-prepare data source for this BPS application. shell commands together with kafka commandlines are used to simplify the data source. Some logging tools like logstash, system logger can be used to productify the process. 

6. There are several ways to run the application, please follow either of the following methods to run the application. **NOTE:**You need to 'Enable run' in the settings of impacted paragraphs, and cluster mode is used by default here.

    6.1. Local mode
      please follow **_STOP LOCAL MODE EXECUTION & START LOCAL MODE_ paragraphs**.
    
    6.2. Cluster mode
      pleaes follow **_DOCKERIZE THE APPLICATION_ & _PUBLISH DOCKER IMAGE_ paragraph** to dockize and push application container to docker registry. sandbox hosted docker registry is used for this example, you can change to use the official ericsson one instead. 
      Please follow **_UNDEPLOY WITH PAASMANAGER_ & _DEPLOY WITH PAASMANAGER_** to deploy/undeploy application service, NOTE: Please use the scripts provided in the bin folder for these actions. curl command is used here due to some path issue.
        

7. Please follow **_SIMULATE WEB ACCESS ACTION_ paragraphs** to curl the sandbox home page with different user agents.

8. Please follow **_VERIFY OUTPUT TABLE & ANALYSIS WEB CLIENT TYPE_ paragraphs** to verify the output and do some exploratory analysis.

result.msg:
1. Please follow AIA avro schema tutorial Notebook to import avro schema for this example.

  2. Please follow STOP RUNNING APPLICATION paragraph to stop any existing running application or service.

  3. Please follow DROP OUTPUT TABLE paragraph to drop the output hive table.

  4. Please follow BUILD APPLICATION PROJECT paragraph to build the maven based application.

  5. Please follow STOP DATA SOURCE & START DATA SOURCE paragraphs to re-prepare data source for this BPS application. shell commands together with kafka commandlines are used to simplify the data source. Some logging tools like logstash, system logger can be used to productify the process.

  6. There are several ways to run the application, please follow either of the following methods to run the application. NOTE:You need to 'Enable run' in the settings of impacted paragraphs, and cluster mode is used by default here.

    6.1. Local mode
    please follow STOP LOCAL MODE EXECUTION & START LOCAL MODE paragraphs.

    6.2. Cluster mode
    pleaes follow DOCKERIZE THE APPLICATION & PUBLISH DOCKER IMAGE paragraph to dockize and push application container to docker registry. sandbox hosted docker registry is used for this example, you can change to use the official ericsson one instead.
    Please follow UNDEPLOY WITH PAASMANAGER & DEPLOY WITH PAASMANAGER to deploy/undeploy application service, NOTE: Please use the scripts provided in the bin folder for these actions. curl command is used here due to some path issue.

  7. Please follow SIMULATE WEB ACCESS ACTION paragraphs to curl the sandbox home page with different user agents.

  8. Please follow VERIFY OUTPUT TABLE & ANALYSIS WEB CLIENT TYPE paragraphs to verify the output and do some exploratory analysis.

paragraphs.title: STOP RUNNING APPLICATION
DROP OUTPUT TABLE
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive)
drop table if exists spark_streaming_output

paragraphs.title: BUILD APPLICATION PROJECT
paragraphs.text:
%sh
sudo -u cloud-user -i mvn clean install -f /home/cloud-user/example/spark-streaming-example-app/pom.xml >> /tmp/spark-streaming-example-app-build.log
sleep 1m

paragraphs.title: STOP DATA SOURCE
paragraphs.text:
%sh
ps -ef | grep "tail -f /var/log/httpd/access_log" | grep -v grep | awk '{print $2}'| xargs -I {} kill -9 {}

paragraphs.title: START DATA SOURCE
paragraphs.text:
%sh
nohup sh -c 'tail -f /var/log/httpd/access_log | kafka-console-producer --broker-list localhost:9092 --topic spark-streaming-topic' > /dev/null 2>&1 &

paragraphs.title: STOP LOCAL MODE EXECUTION
paragraphs.text:
%sh
ps -ef | grep "com.ericsson.component.aia.services.bps.engine.service.BPSPipeLineExecuter" | grep "/home/cloud-user/example/spark-streaming-example-app/flow.xml" | awk '{print $2}' | xargs -I {} kill -9 {}

paragraphs.title: START LOCAL MODE
paragraphs.text:
%sh
sudo -u cloud-user -i spark-submit --class com.ericsson.component.aia.services.bps.engine.service.BPSPipeLineExecuter --deploy-mode client --conf spark.executor.extraJavaOptions="-DschemaRegistry.address=http://localhost:8081" /home/cloud-user/example/spark-streaming-example-app/target/spark-streaming-example-app-all-in-one.jar /home/cloud-user/example/spark-streaming-example-app/flow.xml &

paragraphs.title: DOCKERIZE THE APPLICATION
paragraphs.text:
%sh 
cd /home/cloud-user/example/spark-streaming-example-app
docker build -t localhost:5000/aia/bps-spark-streaming-example-app:1.0.1 .

paragraphs.title: PUBLISH DOCKER IMAGE
paragraphs.text:
%sh
docker push localhost:5000/aia/bps-spark-streaming-example-app:1.0.1 >> /tmp/spark-streaming-example-app-build.log

paragraphs.title: STOP EXISTING LOCAL MODE EXECUTION
paragraphs.text:
%sh
ps -ef | grep "com.ericsson.component.aia.services.bps.engine.service.BPSPipeLineExecuter" | grep "/home/cloud-user/example/spark-streaming-example-app/flow.xml" | awk '{print $2}' | xargs -I {} kill -9 {}

result.msg:
kill: sending signal to 22231 failed: No such process
kill: sending signal to 22231 failed: No such process
ExitValue: 137

paragraphs.title: UNDEPLOY WITH PAASMANAGER
paragraphs.text:
%sh
curl -X DELETE http://localhost:8888/paas/v1/applications --data @/home/cloud-user/example/spark-streaming-example-app/pba.json -H "Content-Type: application/json"

paragraphs.title: DEPLOY WITH PAASMANAGER
paragraphs.text:
%sh
sudo -u cloud-user -i hadoop fs -rm /tmp/flow.xml
sudo -u cloud-user -i hadoop fs -copyFromLocal /home/cloud-user/example/spark-streaming-example-app/flow.xml /tmp
sudo -u cloud-user -i hadoop fs -rm /tmp/spark-streaming-example-app-all-in-one.jar
sudo -u cloud-user -i hadoop fs -copyFromLocal /home/cloud-user/example/spark-streaming-example-app/target/spark-streaming-example-app-all-in-one.jar /tmp
curl -X POST http://localhost:8888/paas/v1/applications --data @/home/cloud-user/example/spark-streaming-example-app/pba.json -H "Content-Type: application/json"

paragraphs.title: VERIFY OUTPUT TABLE
paragraphs.text:
%hive
show tables

paragraphs.title: ANALYSIS WEB CLIENT TYPE
paragraphs.text:
%hive
select user_agent, count(*) from spark_streaming_output group by user_agent

result.msg:
user_agent	_c1
Chrome	20
Firefox	20
MSIE	20
Opera	10
Safari	30

paragraphs.title: FLOW DESCRIPTOR
paragraphs.text:
%sh
cat /home/cloud-user/example/spark-streaming-example-app/flow.xml

result.msg:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<FlowDefinition
    xmlns="urn:com:ericsson:schema:xml:oss:fbp_flow"
    xmlns:oc="urn:com:ericsson:schema:xml:oss:oss_common"
    xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" oc:ns="com.ericsson.oss.services" oc:name="CSLSolutionSet" oc:version="1.0.0">
    <oc:modelCreationInfo author="eachsaj" creationDate="25/5/2016">
        <oc:designedModel componentId="BatchProcessingSpark" />
    </oc:modelCreationInfo>
    <oc:desc>ExtEps Test for an extension Simple Batch Processing</oc:desc>
    <input name="radio-stream">
        <attribute name="uri" value="kafka://spark-streaming-topic"/>
        <attribute name ="metadata.broker.list" value="172.17.0.1:9092"/>
        <attribute name="window.length" value="2"/>
        <attribute name="slide.window.length" value="1"/>
        <attribute name="group.id" value="1"/>
        <attribute name="kafka.keyClass" value="java.lang.String"/>
        <attribute name="kafka.valueClass" value="java.lang.String"/>
        <attribute name="kafka.keyDecoder.class" value="kafka.serializer.StringDecoder"/>
        <attribute name="kafka.valueDecoder.class" value="kafka.serializer.StringDecoder"/>	
        <attribute name="event.type" value="com.ericsson.aia.example.model.access_log"/>
        <attribute name="schema.registry" value="http://172.17.0.1:8081"/>
    </input>
    <step name="ups-spark-streaming">
        <attribute name="uri" value="spark-streaming://SparkStreamingExampleApp"/>
        <attribute name="master.url" value="spark://172.17.0.1:7077"/>
        <attribute name="spark.externalBlockStore.url" value="alluxio://172.17.0.1:19998"/>
        <attribute name="spark.externalBlockStore.baseDir" value="alluxio://172.17.0.1:19998/staging/ups/"/>
        <attribute name="streaming.checkpoint" value="alluxio://172.17.0.1:19998/ups-checkpoint/kafka"/>
        <attribute name="driver-class" value="com.ericsson.aia.bps.streaming.correlations.SparkStreamingExampleApp" />
    </step>
    <output name="hive-output">
        <attribute name="uri" value="hive://spark_streaming_output"/>
        <attribute name="data.format" value="parquet"/>
        <attribute name="data.save.mode" value="Append"/>
    </output>
<output name="kafka-output">
    <attribute name="uri" value="kafka://spark-streaming-output-topic?format=avro"/>
    <attribute name="bootstrap.servers" value="172.17.0.1:9092"/>
    <attribute name="eventType" value="com.ericsson.aia.example.model.access_log"/>
  </output>
    <path>
        <from uri="radio-stream" />
        <to uri="spark-streaming" />
        <to uri="hive-output" />
        <to uri="kafka-output"/>
    </path>
</FlowDefinition>
